Crime_Name: Persecution due to religious and ethnic conversion
Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Grounds_for_Claim: Race, religion, nationality, membership in a social group, political opinion
Remedy_Requested: Refugee protection due to well-founded fear of persecution
Legal_Framework: Convention refugee definition under domestic immigration law
Evidence_Requirement: Well-founded fear of persecution, lack of state protection
Decision_Outcome: Case remitted for reconsideration by a different panel
Evidence_Type: Threats, violence, property damage, police inaction, complaints
Geographic_Context: Country of origin where persecution occurred
Personal_Data_Implicated: Religious belief, ethnic identity, migration history
Governing_Body: CRDD, Federal Court on judicial review
Complaint_Issues: Lack of state protection, police inaction, threats, violence, property damage
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution based on protected grounds
Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to absence of state protection
State_Protection_Assessment: Inadequate: police failed to act despite complaints
Risk_Factor: Targeted due to religious and ethnic conversion
Credibility: Not explicitly challenged; evidence supported claims of harm
Legal_Provision: Section defining convention refugee in Immigration Act
Targeted_Group: Individuals who converted religiously and ethnically
Risk_Nature: Serious personal harm including violence and property destruction
Enforcement_Action: No effective enforcement by local police
Perpetrator_Entity: Private actors and state authorities through omission
Legal_Basis: International refugee law, domestic implementation via Immigration Act
